title: Titus Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Titus with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the book of Titus?
questions.explanation: Paul identifies himself as the author in Titus 1:1.

questions.question: To whom is the book of Titus addressed?
questions.explanation: Paul addresses the letter to Titus, his 'own son after the common faith.'

questions.question: What was the primary reason Paul left Titus in Crete?
options: To set in order the things that are wanting and ordain elders in every city
To deliver a collection to Jerusalem
To visit the churches in Galatia
questions.correctAnswer: To set in order the things that are wanting and ordain elders in every city
questions.explanation: Paul left Titus in Crete to organize the church and appoint elders.

questions.question: According to Titus 1, what is one qualification for an elder?
options: Must be married to many wives
Must be blameless, the husband of one wife
questions.correctAnswer: Must be blameless, the husband of one wife
questions.explanation: Elders must be blameless and the husband of one wife according to Titus 1:6.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a character trait required of a bishop (elder) in Titus 1?
questions.explanation: An elder must not be given to filthy lucre (money), but a lover of hospitality.

questions.question: What must an elder hold fast according to Titus 1:9?
options: The faithful word as he hath been taught
questions.correctAnswer: The faithful word as he hath been taught
questions.explanation: An elder must hold fast the faithful word to exhort and convince gainsayers.

questions.question: Who are described as unruly and vain talkers in Titus 1?
questions.explanation: Paul warns about the circumcision group who cause trouble.

questions.question: What did a prophet of their own say about the Cretans?
options: They are always truthful and kind
The Cretans are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies
questions.correctAnswer: The Cretans are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies
questions.explanation: Paul quotes one of their own prophets describing the Cretans negatively.

questions.question: What should Titus do with those who teach things they ought not for filthy lucre's sake?
questions.explanation: Paul instructs Titus to stop their mouths as they subvert whole houses.

questions.question: According to Titus 2, how should aged men behave?
options: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, and patience
questions.correctAnswer: Sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, and patience
questions.explanation: Paul instructs aged men to have these godly qualities.

questions.question: What are aged women encouraged to teach young women according to Titus 2?
options: To love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, keepers at home
questions.correctAnswer: To love their husbands and children, be discreet, chaste, keepers at home
questions.explanation: Aged women are to teach young women godly behavior.

questions.question: How should servants behave toward their masters according to Titus 2?
options: Obediently, not answering again, not purloining, showing all good fidelity
questions.correctAnswer: Obediently, not answering again, not purloining, showing all good fidelity
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts servants to behave well to adorn the doctrine of God.

questions.question: What appeared to all men, bringing salvation, according to Titus 2?
questions.explanation: The grace of God bringing salvation appeared to all men.

questions.question: What does the grace of God teach us, according to Titus 2:12?
options: To deny ungodliness and worldly lusts, live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.correctAnswer: To deny ungodliness and worldly lusts, live soberly, righteously, and godly
questions.explanation: Grace teaches us to live godly lives in this present world.

questions.question: What hope are believers looking for, as mentioned in Titus 2?
options: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The blessed hope and glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Believers look for Christ's glorious appearing as their blessed hope.

questions.question: Why did Jesus give Himself for us, according to Titus 2?
options: That He might redeem us from all iniquity and purify unto Himself a peculiar people
questions.correctAnswer: That He might redeem us from all iniquity and purify unto Himself a peculiar people
questions.explanation: Jesus gave Himself to redeem and purify a special people zealous of good works.

questions.question: What manner of speech should Titus show, according to Titus 2?
questions.explanation: Titus is to show sound speech that cannot be condemned.

questions.question: What should Titus be an example of, in all things?
questions.explanation: Titus should show himself a pattern of good works.

questions.question: According to Titus 3, what should believers be ready for?
questions.explanation: Believers should be ready for every good work as instructed.

questions.question: How are believers told to behave toward others, according to Titus 3?
options: Speak evil of no man, be gentle, showing all meekness
questions.correctAnswer: Speak evil of no man, be gentle, showing all meekness
questions.explanation: Believers should avoid brawling and be gentle to all men.

questions.question: How were believers described before their salvation in Titus 3?
options: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures
questions.explanation: Believers were formerly foolish and disobedient before salvation.

questions.question: According to Titus 3:5, how are we saved?
options: By works of righteousness we have done
According to His mercy by the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: According to His mercy by the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Salvation is by mercy, not works, through regeneration and renewal.

questions.question: Who did Paul say shed the Holy Ghost abundantly upon us?
questions.explanation: The Holy Ghost was shed abundantly through Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What is the result of being justified by His grace according to Titus 3?
options: We become heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.correctAnswer: We become heirs according to the hope of eternal life
questions.explanation: Being justified by grace makes us heirs according to hope.

questions.question: What does Paul exhort Titus to affirm constantly, according to Titus 3?
options: The faithful saying that those who believe in God should maintain good works
questions.correctAnswer: The faithful saying that those who believe in God should maintain good works
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes the importance of good works for believers.

questions.question: What kinds of questions does Paul advise Titus to avoid?
options: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law
questions.correctAnswer: Foolish questions, genealogies, contentions, and strivings about the law
questions.explanation: These disputes are unprofitable and vain.

questions.question: What should be done with a man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition?
questions.explanation: Paul commands rejecting a heretick after repeated warnings.

questions.question: Where does Paul say he has determined to winter?
questions.explanation: Paul plans to winter at Nicopolis.

questions.question: Who does Paul mention sending to Titus, or possibly Tychicus?
questions.explanation: Paul mentions Artemas or Tychicus being sent to Titus.

questions.question: Who are the two men Paul instructs Titus to bring on their journey diligently?
questions.explanation: Paul asks Titus to assist Zenas and Apollos.

questions.question: What should we learn to maintain for necessary uses, according to Titus 3?
questions.explanation: Believers should maintain good works that are not unfruitful.

questions.question: How does Paul close the letter to Titus?
options: With a greeting and a wish for grace
questions.correctAnswer: With a greeting and a wish for grace
questions.explanation: Paul sends greetings and wishes grace to all.

questions.question: True or False: Titus was instructed to ordain elders in every city in Crete.
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly charges Titus to ordain elders in every city.

questions.question: True or False: Elders can be self-willed and given to wine according to Titus 1.
questions.explanation: Elders must not be self-willed or given to wine.

questions.question: True or False: The Cretians are described as honest and diligent workers in Titus 1.
questions.explanation: They are described as liars, evil beasts, and slow bellies.

questions.question: True or False: Paul instructs Titus to speak things which become sound doctrine.
questions.explanation: Titus is to teach sound doctrine.

questions.question: True or False: Young men are exhorted to be sober minded.
questions.explanation: Paul exhorts young men to be sober minded.

questions.question: True or False: Servants are told to purloin from their masters in Titus 2.
questions.explanation: Servants are told not to purloin but to show good fidelity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Titus 2, the grace of God that bringeth salvation appeared to all men.
questions.explanation: The grace of God appeared to all men.

questions.question: True or False: We are saved by works of righteousness according to Titus 3.
questions.explanation: Salvation is not by works but by God's mercy.

questions.question: True or False: Believers are to be subject to principalities and powers.
questions.explanation: Paul instructs believers to be subject to authorities.

questions.question: True or False: Paul says to avoid foolish questions and contentions about the law.
questions.explanation: Such disputes are unprofitable and vain.

questions.question: True or False: Paul commands Titus to welcome heretics after the first admonition.
questions.explanation: He commands to reject heretics after the first and second admonition.

questions.question: True or False: Paul mentions sending Artemas or Tychicus to Titus.
questions.explanation: Paul says he will send Artemas or Tychicus.

questions.question: True or False: Paul describes himself as a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ.
questions.explanation: Paul opens the letter with this description.
